content: The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act Amendments of 2000 include provisions such as restriction on waiver authority, assistance to non-low-income families, labor standards, environmental compliance, oversight, allocation formula, hearing requirement, and technical amendments. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to allow the Secretary to grant a 90-day waiver to Indian tribes for non-compliance due to uncontrollable circumstances. Additionally, the Secretary may waive certain requirements if the recipient has made a good faith effort to comply and agrees to make tax payments. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 allows the Secretary to grant a 90-day waiver to Indian tribes for non-compliance due to uncontrollable circumstances. The Secretary may also waive requirements if the recipient has made a good faith effort to comply and agrees to make tax payments. SEC. 3. Assistance to families that are not low-income includes evidence of housing need that cannot be met without assistance. SEC. 4. Elimination of waiver authority for small tribes by amending subsections. SEC. 5. Labor standards. SEC. 5. LABOR STANDARDS. Amendment to the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 regarding the Davis-Bacon Act and application of tribal laws to contracts. Section 105 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to allow the Secretary to waive environmental compliance requirements under certain conditions. Section 105 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to allow recipients to correct certain violations on their own. SEC. 7. Oversight. Amends sections 209 and 405 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 to address noncompliance with affordable housing requirements and to allow for reviews and audits by the Secretary. An Indian tribe's designated housing entity is subject to audit requirements under Chapter 75 of Title 31, United States Code. The Secretary may conduct additional audits to ensure timely and eligible activities are carried out by recipients. The Secretary may conduct audits to verify the accuracy of performance reports and compliance with Indian housing plans. Onsite visits by HUD officials may be included in the reviews. The Secretary allows recipients to review and comment on reports for at least 30 days. After considering recipient comments, the Secretary may revise the report and make it publicly available within 30 days. This process is subject to section 401(a) and includes audits to verify accuracy and compliance with Indian housing plans. The Secretary may adjust grant amounts based on reviews of reports and audits submitted by recipients under this Act. SEC. 8. ALLOCATION FORMULA. Section 302(d)(1) of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to provide a formula for Indian tribes with fewer than 250 public housing units starting from fiscal year 2000. The Act provides a formula for Indian tribes with fewer than 250 public housing units to receive modernization assistance based on the average annual funds received from 1992 to 1997 under the assistance program. SEC. 9. HEARING REQUIREMENT. Section 401(a) of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to redesignate paragraphs and specify actions the Secretary can take. The Secretary can take action if a recipient fails to comply with key provisions of the Act resulting in unauthorized federal fund expenditure, without a hearing, but must provide notice to the recipient. The Secretary can take action without a hearing if a recipient fails to comply with Act provisions, but must provide notice. A hearing must be conducted within 60 days of the notice. After the hearing, the Secretary will make a determination on whether to continue the action or take another action. SEC. 10. PERFORMANCE AGREEMENT TIME LIMIT. Section 401(b) of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to specify compliance objectives in a performance agreement with the Secretary. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include compliance objectives in a performance agreement with the Secretary, lasting for 1 year and subject to review upon termination. If the recipient has made a good faith effort to meet the objectives, the Secretary may enter into an additional performance agreement. The Secretary may enter into an additional performance agreement for the specified period if the recipient fails to make a good faith effort to meet compliance objectives, they will be deemed to have substantially failed to comply with the Act and will be subject to action under subsection (a). SEC. 11. TECHNICAL AND CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Amends the table of contents of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 by removing items relating to section 206 and 209, and inserting new item for section 209. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to address noncompliance with affordable housing requirements, repeal Section 206, and amend Section 502(a) regarding terminations of housing contracts for tenant-based assistance. Passed by the Senate on February 28, 2000.
